results.title: Testing hypotheses
results.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of Science”
Scientific hypotheses don’t gain much respect until they have been tested. Some can be tested experimentally, others only through the weight of evidence. Pasteur’s classic experiments relating to spontaneous generation illustrate the former and the mass of evidence supporting theories of evolution illustrate the latter. For primary grades.

results.title: Testify
results.brief_description: ‘Testify’ is a song by American rock band Rage Against the Machine and the third single from their third album The Battle of Los Angeles.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description:
‘Testify’ is a song by American rock band Rage Against the Machine and the third single from their third album The Battle of Los Angeles.

The cover of the single was taken from the 1968 Olympics Black Power Salute. The song’s lyrics notably make reference to George Orwell’s novel 1984 through use of “The Party” slogan “Who controls the past (now), controls the future. Who controls the present (now), controls the past.”
description_for_label:
‘Testify’ is a song by American rock band Rage Against the Machine and the third single from their third album The Battle of Los Angeles.

The cover of the single was taken from the 1968 Olympics Black Power Salute. The song’s lyrics notably make reference to George Orwell’s novel 1984 through use of “The Party” slogan “Who controls the past (now), controls the future. Who controls the present (now), controls the past.”

results.title: Testament: The Bible and history
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Ron Johnston, Antelope Films and Channel 4
results.brief_description: John Romer, an emminent archaelogist, undertakes a personal quest to examine the history of the Bible. He explores its origins and evolution through time as a rare and valuable sacred text, to a modern day paperback best seller available to the masses. Romer does not set out to discredit or disprove the literal truth of the Bible, but to examine how this influential text has shaped the world.

results.title: Test pilot
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Baines and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Danger”
Appraises the qualities needed by a test pilot and shows his day to day work, not only in actual flying but also in cooperating with the back-room boys.

results.title: Test flight 263
results.creator_credit: Film Producers Guild and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: Modern British aircraft development, with particular emphasis on recent experiments and achievements in supersonic flight. The learning, and discerning, planning and calculating of mathematicians, designers, technologists and pilots contribute to development of new and revolutionary aircraft.

results.title: Tertiary training in the RAAF
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film depicts the training and lifestyles of the RAAF cadets. It shows the three study courses that are available to them in Australia; degrees in science, engineering and business studies. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Territorial rights
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 7 of a series of films for managers. Examines the reasons why so many misunderstandings occur between specialists and the “line” managers they advise. A film of an argument between a production manager and a services engineer is used as the basis for a discussion between personnel, finance and works managers, and consultants on the sources of interdepartmental problems. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Termite colony: a complex social organization
results.brief_description: A discussion of the polymorphic social organisation within an African termite colony, describing the unique roles of the queen, soldiers, and workers in the colony. Shows the care for the queen during the egg laying stage and the care for the young after the eggs hatch; the cultivation of a food supply for the colony; the defence of the colony by the soldiers; and the repair of the nest by the workers.

results.title: Teresa's story
results.creator_credit: John Anderson, Brent Productions and Wellington Community Law Centre
results.brief_description: This program was designed for use by schools and community groups, targets 12 to 17 year olds and people supporting them, and aims to inform about how the Child Protection system deals with reported abuse, the right of young people to personal safety and their legal rights under the Care and Protection Section of the Children, Young Persons and their Families Act, New Zealand.
